basics.name: Joseph Frimpong
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Physical Chemistry
basics.summary: A Postdoctoral researcher with experience in simulating nanoscale materials of interest in energy, catalysis and device applications. I also enjoy developing computational tools for studying electronic structure and optical properties of materials leveraging  machine learning and AI.

work.name: Wayne State University
work.summary: Developed computational methods/tools based on many-body perturbation theory to study electronic structure and optical properties of material interfaces
highlights: Developed GW/BSE methods for large heterogeneous interfaces
Implemented machine learning models for materials discovery
Studied electronic/optical properties of quantum dots, COFs, organic-metal interfaces

work.name: Wayne State University
work.summary: Developed deep learning models and conducted data analysis on various projects.
highlights: Built deep learning model for air quality prediction
Analyzed NIH proposals using Python/SQL and visualized data in Tableau
Developed NLP model for text data processing

volunteer.summary: Promoted science education and diversity in STEM fields through outreach activities.
Assisted in organizing the NOBCChE National Conference.

education.institution: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

Extending the substrate screening GW approximation to covalently bound interfaces
Electrochemical Hydrogen Isotope Exchange of Amines Controlled by Alternating Current Frequency
Comparative Study of Covalent and van der Waals CdS Quantum Dot Assemblies from Many-Body Perturbation Theory
